label: Weekly Fire Pump Testing
info_popup:
Fire pumps serving sprinkler systems must be tested weekly to ensure they start and operate correctly.

⚖️ IS EN 12845:2020, NFPA 20

label: Annual Fire Pump Service
info_popup:
Annual comprehensive service and testing of fire pumps by qualified technician.

⚖️ IS EN 12845:2020, NFPA 20

label: FOG (Fats, Oils, Grease) Licence
info_popup:
FOG discharge licence from local authority must be maintained and reviewed annually.

⚖️ Water Services Act, Local Authority licensing requirements

label: Grease Trap Schematic Documentation
info_popup:
Grease trap schematic must be documented and reviewed annually to ensure compliance with drainage regulations.

⚖️ Water Services Act, Local Authority requirements

label: Quarterly Grease Trap Cleaning Records
info_popup:
Grease traps must be cleaned quarterly with records maintained of cleaning and waste collection.

⚖️ Water Services Act, Environmental regulations

label: Quarterly Waste Oil Collection Records
info_popup:
Records of waste oil/grease collection by licensed waste contractors must be maintained.

⚖️ Waste Management Act, Environmental Protection Agency requirements

tasks.label: Annual Fire Risk Assessment
tasks.info_popup:
A fire risk assessment must be carried out by a competent person at least annually, or after major changes. It identifies hazards and control measures.

⚖️ Fire Services Act 1981 & 2003 (Ireland); Regulatory Reform (Fire Safety) Order 2005 (UK)

tasks.label: Quarterly Fire Alarm Service Certificate
tasks.info_popup:
Fire alarm systems must be serviced quarterly by a qualified technician to verify full system operation.

⚖️ IS 3218:2013+A1:2019, Clause 11.2 (Ireland); BS 5839-1:2017 (UK)

tasks.label: Annual Fire Extinguisher Service Certificate
tasks.info_popup:
All fire extinguishers must be serviced annually by a competent person and a certificate issued. Records must be retained for inspection.

⚖️ IS 291:2015, Clause 13 (Ireland); BS 5306-3 (UK)

tasks.label: Annual Emergency Lighting Test Certificate
tasks.info_popup:
An annual 3-hour full discharge test of all emergency lighting systems must be conducted and certified. This ensures compliance with emergency evacuation requirements.

⚖️ IS 3217:2013+A1:2017, Clause 12.4.3.3 (Ireland); BS 5266-1 (UK)

tasks.label: Annual Sprinkler System Service Certificate
tasks.info_popup:
Sprinklers must be inspected annually.

⚖️ IS EN 12845:2020

tasks.label: Annual Dry Riser Test Certificate
tasks.info_popup:
Dry risers must be pressure tested annually.

⚖️ BS 9990:2015

tasks.label: Kitchen Extract/Hood Cleaning
tasks.info_popup:
Kitchen extract systems and hoods must be professionally cleaned twice annually to prevent grease buildup and fire risk.

⚖️ Fire Safety regulations and insurance requirements

tasks.label: Annual Fire Damper Service
tasks.info_popup:
Fire dampers must be tested annually to ensure they close properly in case of fire.

⚖️ BS 5588 and building regulations

tasks.label: Annual Fire Curtain Service
tasks.info_popup:
Fire curtains must be tested annually for proper operation and deployment.

⚖️ Manufacturer specifications and fire safety regulations

tasks.label: Gas Detection System Testing
tasks.info_popup:
Gas detection systems must be tested annually for proper function and calibration.

⚖️ Gas safety regulations

tasks.label: Lightning Conductor Service
tasks.info_popup:
Lightning protection systems must be tested annually if installed.

⚖️ BS EN 62305

tasks.label: Fall Arrest Equipment Service
tasks.info_popup:
Fall arrest equipment must be inspected annually if installed for roof/maintenance access.

⚖️ Work at Height Regulations

tasks.label: Monthly Sprinkler Valve Position Check
tasks.info_popup:
Main sprinkler control valves must be checked monthly to ensure they remain in the open position.

⚖️ IS EN 12845:2020, NFPA 25

tasks.label: Quarterly Emergency Lighting Function Test
tasks.info_popup:
Function tests ensure emergency lighting activates correctly during mains power failure. A brief test is required at least every 3 months.

⚖️ IS 3217:2013+A1:2017, Clause 12.4.3.2 (Ireland); BS 5266-1 (UK)

tasks.label: Monthly Emergency Lighting Flick Test
tasks.info_popup:
Monthly flick test of emergency lighting to ensure basic function.

⚖️ Best practice maintenance

tasks.label: Monthly Fire Safety Register – Detailed Checks

subtasks.label: Fire Stopping Visual Check (e.g. risers, corridors)

tasks.info_popup:
This section tracks individual components of the fire safety register. Each item must be visually or functionally checked monthly and logged. AOVs and refuge call points must be tested for function, while fire stopping and evacuation equipment should be inspected for visibility, accessibility, and condition.

⚖️ Based on Fire Services Act 1981 & 2003 (Ireland), IS 3218, and UK Fire Safety Order 2005.

tasks.label: Monthly Fire Alarm Zone Test
tasks.info_popup:
Each zone of the fire alarm system must be tested monthly on a rotation to ensure correct function and sounder operation. All zones must be tested within a 3-month period.

⚖️ IS 3218:2013+A1:2019, Clause 9.1.2 (Ireland)

tasks.label: Monthly Fire Door Visual Check
tasks.info_popup:
All fire doors should be checked monthly for damage, signage, closers, and latching. Regular checks reduce risk of fire spread.

⚖️ Recommended in BS 8214 and UK Fire Safety Order 2005 guidance

tasks.label: Fire Door Inspection Records (Internal & External)
tasks.info_popup:
Detailed inspection of fire doors including condition, magnets, and closing mechanisms.

⚖️ Fire safety regulations

tasks.label: Fire Safety Walks/Patrols
tasks.info_popup:
Regular fire safety patrols as per hotel schedule to check for fire hazards and compliance.

⚖️ Fire safety management requirements

tasks.label: Weekly Fire Alarm Test
tasks.info_popup:
At least one manual call point must be tested weekly to confirm sounders operate correctly. Different call points should be tested in rotation.

⚖️ IS 3218:2013+A1:2019, Clause 9.1.1 (Ireland); BS 5839-1:2017 (UK)

tasks.label: Fire Warden Training Records
tasks.info_popup:
Fire wardens/marshals must be appointed and trained to assist with evacuation and fire safety procedures. Records of training must be maintained.

⚖️ Safety, Health and Welfare at Work Act 2005 (Ireland); Regulatory Reform (Fire Safety) Order 2005 (UK)

tasks.label: Fire Evacuation Drill
tasks.frequency: Every 6 months (3 months for night shift)
tasks.info_popup:
Full evacuation drills must be conducted every 6 months (3 months for night shift staff) and documented, including evacuation times and any issues identified.

⚖️ Fire Services Act (Ireland); Regulatory Reform (Fire Safety) Order 2005 (UK)

tasks.label: Fire Evacuation Plan Review
tasks.info_popup:
The fire evacuation plan must be reviewed annually and after any building modifications to ensure it remains current and effective.

⚖️ Fire Services Act (Ireland); Regulatory Reform (Fire Safety) Order 2005 (UK)

tasks.label: Weekly Emergency Exit Route Check
tasks.info_popup:
All emergency exit routes and doors must be checked weekly to ensure they are unobstructed, unlocked and operational.

⚖️ Fire Services Act 1981 & 2003 (Ireland); Regulatory Reform (Fire Safety) Order 2005 (UK)

tasks.label: Electrical Installation Condition Report (EICR)
tasks.info_popup:
All commercial premises must have their fixed electrical installation tested at least every 5 years by a competent electrician. Can be done 20% annually over 5 years. The resulting EICR must be retained.

⚖️ IS 10101:2020 (Ireland), BS 7671 (UK), Safety, Health and Welfare at Work (General Application) Regulations 2007 (Ireland)

tasks.label: Portable Appliance Testing (PAT)
tasks.info_popup:
All portable electrical appliances must be regularly tested for safety. The frequency depends on usage and risk, but annual testing is standard in hospitality.

⚖️ S.I. No. 299/2007 (Ireland); UK PUWER Regulations 1998; IET Code of Practice for In-Service Inspection and Testing of Electrical Equipment

tasks.label: Annual Thermal Imaging of Panels (Recommended)
tasks.info_popup:
Thermal imaging of distribution boards helps detect overheating, overloading, and potential failures before they occur. Especially useful for larger sites with older infrastructure.

⚖️ Best Practice (Insurer recommended; often part of preventive maintenance)

tasks.label: Visual Check of Electrical Distribution Boards
tasks.info_popup:
Quarterly inspection of DBs to ensure they are labelled, closed, free from dust/obstruction, and not tampered with. Look for signs of overheating or burning.

⚖️ Best Practice – IS 10101 and PUWER 1998 (UK)

tasks.label: Annual Gas Safety Certificate
tasks.info_popup:
Gas-fired systems and appliances must be serviced and tested annually by a registered gas installer. A Gas Safety Certificate must be retained.

⚖️ Gas Safety (Installation and Use) Regulations (UK); Gas Safety (Installation and Use) (Amendment) Regulations 2015 (Ireland)

tasks.label: Boiler Service Report
tasks.info_popup:
All commercial boilers must be serviced annually to maintain safety and efficiency. This helps prevent breakdowns and carbon monoxide risks.

⚖️ S.I. No. 299/2007; Irish Gas Technical Standards; UK Gas Safety Regs

tasks.label: Gas Interlock System Testing
tasks.info_popup:
Gas interlock systems in commercial kitchens must be tested annually to ensure they shut off gas supply when ventilation fails.

⚖️ Gas safety regulations and commercial kitchen standards

tasks.label: CO Alarm Function Test
tasks.info_popup:
Carbon monoxide detectors must be tested monthly to ensure audible function and visible indicator. Replace batteries as required.

⚖️ Housing Regulations; Best Practice from Fire Services & NSAI

tasks.label: Legionella Risk Assessment (Every 2 Years)
tasks.info_popup:
A Legionella risk assessment must be carried out by a competent party at least every 2 years or when system changes occur. This identifies potential risks in domestic water systems including tanks, calorifiers, and low-use outlets.

⚖️ S.I. No. 299/2007 (Ireland), HSE ACOP L8 (UK), HPSC Legionella Guidance 2011

tasks.label: Water System Schematics Review
tasks.info_popup:
Water system schematics must be kept current and reviewed annually to support Legionella risk management.

⚖️ HPSC Legionella Guidance 2011, HSE L8

tasks.label: Legionella Water Testing
tasks.info_popup:
Water samples must be tested for Legionella bacteria every 6 months from representative points in the system.

⚖️ HPSC Legionella Guidance, HSE L8

tasks.label: Annual Water Tank Inspection
tasks.info_popup:
Cold water storage tanks must be inspected annually to check for debris, corrosion, stagnant water, or ingress risks. Results must be documented.

⚖️ HPSC Legionella Guidance 2011 (Ireland), HSE L8 (UK)

tasks.label: Water Tank Cleaning and Disinfection
tasks.info_popup:
Water storage tanks must be cleaned and disinfected annually to prevent bacterial growth.

⚖️ HPSC Legionella Guidance, HSE L8

tasks.label: System Chlorination Records
tasks.info_popup:
Records of system chlorination/disinfection when required for remedial action or maintenance.

⚖️ HPSC Legionella Guidance, HSE L8

tasks.label: Annual TMV (Thermostatic Mixing Valve) Service
tasks.info_popup:
Service TMVs annually to prevent Legionella.

⚖️ HSG274 Part 2 (UK), ACOP L8

tasks.label: Quarterly Shower Head Cleaning and Descaling
tasks.info_popup:
Showers must be cleaned and descaled quarterly to prevent biofilm and scale buildup which encourages Legionella colonisation. This is critical for guest and staff safety.

⚖️ HPSC Guidelines, HSE L8 (UK), Best Practice

tasks.label: Monthly Water Temperature Checks
tasks.info_popup:
Temperature checks must be performed at representative sentinel points: cold outlets (<20°C), hot outlets (>50°C), and stored water systems. This helps confirm conditions are not favourable for Legionella growth.

⚖️ HPSC Legionella Control Guidance (Ireland), HSE L8 (UK)

tasks.label: Monthly Calorifier Flow and Return Temperature Check
tasks.info_popup:
Monitor the inlet and outlet temperatures of calorifiers monthly. Flow temperature should exceed 60°C and return at least 50°C to ensure Legionella control.

⚖️ HPSC Legionella Control Guidance, HTM 04-01 (UK Healthcare Guidance)

tasks.label: Weekly Flushing of Low-Use Taps and Showers
tasks.info_popup:
Taps, showers, and outlets that are used less than once a week must be flushed through at least weekly for several minutes. This reduces risk of bacterial growth in stagnant water.

⚖️ HPSC Legionella Control Guidance (Ireland), HSE L8 (UK)

tasks.label: Passenger Lift Inspection Certificate (6-Monthly)
tasks.info_popup:
Lifts carrying people must be thoroughly examined every 6 months by a competent person. This is a statutory requirement and must be documented.

⚖️ S.I. No. 299/2007 (Ireland); LOLER 1998 (UK); SAFed Guidelines

tasks.label: Quarterly Lift Inspection
tasks.info_popup:
Additional quarterly inspections required in addition to 6-monthly thorough examinations.

⚖️ LOLER 1998, SAFed Guidelines

tasks.label: Annual Lift Maintenance Contract Documentation
tasks.info_popup:
Maintain current lift maintenance contract and service records.

⚖️ LOLER 1998 requirements

tasks.label: Monthly Lift Emergency Phone Line Test
tasks.info_popup:
All lifts must have an emergency communication line tested monthly to ensure guests or staff can reach help if trapped.

⚖️ Best Practice; SAFed/LOLER Guidance (UK); Fire Services compliance (Ireland)

tasks.label: Annual Safety Statement Review
tasks.info_popup:
A written safety statement outlining workplace risks and control measures must be reviewed at least once annually or after significant changes.

⚖️ Safety, Health and Welfare at Work Act 2005 (Ireland)

tasks.label: Hotel Crisis Manual Review
tasks.info_popup: Crisis management manual must be reviewed annually
